activities.loc: Br 10 - Law Enforcement Center - West Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dajuann D Bogan

records.addlTxt:
8:38 AM Defendant Dajuann D Bogan in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Dajuann D Bogan.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 

Defense requests adjournment. 
BTC: Matter adjourned.
Status conference scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:28 AM Defendant Dajuann D Bogan not in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Dajuann D Bogan.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Atty Ramirez requests warrant be stayed. 
State asks for warrant to issue right away. 
BTC: No appearance, Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond forfeited. STAYED 72 HOURS.

10:33 AM Defendant Dajuann D Bogan in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Dajuann D Bogan via zoom.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
BTC: Vacate warrant and reinstate bond. 
Defendant indicates that he was confused by the time. 
Defense requests a status moving forward. 
BTC: Matter set over.

9:11 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dajuann D Bogan in court.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Dajuann D Bogan. Court Reporter Sara Rogan. 
Defense has an offer but still needs time to see if they can negotiate further, requests another status date. 
BTC: Matter set over.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on October 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.
DA AUTHORIZATION TO OBTAIN COPIES OF CERTAIN EVIDENCE

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Patricia J Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dajuann D Bogan in court, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez in court for Dajuann D Bogan. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
State calls Officer Cruz- Ortiz, DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
Parties rest.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects.
BTC: probable cause found, bound over on charges.
Status conference scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. Do not drive at all.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Jessica E. H. Lynott in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Dajuann D Bogan appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Juan Sebastian Ramirez appeared by video for Dajuann D Bogan. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on May 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Initial appearance on May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to Wisconsin's Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020 this hearing being held via video and telephone conferencing. You may view this hearing by using the following link:  https://www.wicourts.gov/courts/livestream.htm, Racine County, Judicial Court Commissioner
